prompt: <description>Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. Part 1: Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin with no rotation and a translation vector of [0, 0, 0]. Next, create a sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. 1. Draw line 1 from [0, 0] to [0.4286, 0]. 2. Draw line 2 from [0.4286, 0] to [0.4286, 0.4821]. 3. Draw line 3 from [0.4286, 0.4821] to [0, 0.4821]. 4. Draw line 4 from [0, 0.4821] to [0, 0]. Close the loop and exit the sketch. Extrude the sketch along the normal direction by 0.75 units. Scale the sketch by 0.4821. The resulting solid body represents part 1. Part 2: Create a new coordinate system at [0.0268, 0.0268, 0.75] with no rotation and a translation vector of [0, 0, 0]. Next, draw four sketches on corresponding faces of the coordinate system, described as follows: Sketch on face 1: 1. Draw line 1 from [0, 0] to [0.1813, 0]. 2. Draw line 2 from [0.1813, 0] to [0.1813, 0.2006]. 3. Draw line 3 from [0.1813, 0.2006] to [0, 0.2006]. 4. Draw line 4 from [0, 0.2006] to [0, 0]. Close the loop and exit the sketch. Sketch on face 2: 1. Draw line 1 from [0, 0.2273] to [0.1813, 0.2273]. 2. Draw line 2 from [0.1813, 0.2273] to [0.1813, 0.4286]. 3. Draw line 3 from [0.1813, 0.4286] to [0, 0.4286]. 4. Draw line 4 from [0, 0.4286] to [0, 0.2273]. Close the loop and exit the sketch. Sketch on face 3: 1. Draw line 1 from [0.208, 0] to [0.375, 0]. 2. Draw line 2 from [0.375, 0] to [0.375, 0.2006]. 3. Draw line 3 from [0.375, 0.2006] to [0.208, 0.2006]. 4. Draw line 4 from [0.208, 0.2006] to [0.208, 0]. Close the loop and exit the sketch. Sketch on face 4: 1. Draw line 1 from [0.208, 0.2273] to [0.375, 0.2273]. 2. Draw line 2 from [0.375, 0.2273] to [0.375, 0.4286]. 3. Draw line 3 from [0.375, 0.4286] to [0.208, 0.4286]. 4. Draw line 4 from [0.208, 0.4286] to [0.208, 0.2273]. Close the loop and exit the sketch. Extrude each sketch by 0.7232 units in the opposite normal direction. The resulting solid body represents part 2, which cuts into part 1 to form the final shape.</description>
